alert.note: Alert for Craighead (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 1:15PM CST until February 08 at 3:40PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of East Arkansas, including the following counties, Craighead and Poinsett. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 114 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jonesboro, Trumann, Lake City, Bay, Greenfield, Apt, Cary, Valley View, Hergett, Gilkerson, Farrville, Davis Spur, Gum Point, Needham, Otwell and Craighead Forest Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
